2.1: How has the Lord covered the daughter of Zion with a cloud in his anger!
2.2: The Lord has swallowed up all the dwellings of Jacob
2.3: He has cut off all the horn of Israel in fierce anger.
2.4: He has bent his bow like an enemy.
2.5: The Lord has become as an enemy.
2.6: He has violently taken away his tabernacle,
2.7: The Lord has cast off his altar.
2.8: Yahweh has purposed to destroy the wall of the daughter of Zion.
2.9: Her gates have sunk into the ground.
2.10: The elders of the daughter of Zion sit on the ground.
2.13: What shall I testify to you?
2.14: Your prophets have seen false and foolish visions for you.
2.15: All that pass by clap their hands at you.
2.16: All your enemies have opened their mouth wide against you.
2.17: Yahweh has done that which he planned.
2.18: Their heart cried to the Lord.
2.19: Arise, cry out in the night,
2.20: “Look, Yahweh, and see to whom you have done thus!
2.21: “The youth and the old man lie on the ground in the streets.
2.22: “You have called, as in the day of a solemn assembly, my terrors on every side.

3.1: I am the man who has seen affliction

3.3: Surely he turns his hand against me
3.4: He has made my flesh and my skin old.

3.14: I have become a derision to all my people,
3.15: He has filled me with bitterness.

3.19: Remember my affliction and my misery,
3.21: This I recall to my mind;

3.24: “Yahweh is my portion,” says my soul.

3.28: Let him sit alone and keep silence,

4.1: How the gold has become dim!
4.3: Even the jackals offer their breast.
4.4: The tongue of the nursing child clings to the roof of his mouth for thirst.
4.5: Those who ate delicacies are desolate in the streets.
4.6: For the iniquity of the daughter of my people is greater than the sin of Sodom,
4.7: Her nobles were purer than snow.
4.8: Their appearance is blacker than a coal.
4.9: Those who are killed with the sword are better than those who are killed with hunger;
4.10: The hands of the pitiful women have boiled their own children.
4.12: The kings of the earth didn’t believe,
4.13: It is because of the sins of her prophets
4.14: They wander as blind men in the streets.
4.19: Our pursuers were swifter than the eagles of the sky.
4.21: Rejoice and be glad, daughter of Edom,
4.22: The punishment of your iniquity is accomplished, daughter of Zion.

5.4: We must pay for water to drink.
